column1: #Text=Polycrystalline samples of CaBa1−xPbxZn2Ga2O7 (0 ≤ x ≤ 1) and CaSr0.5Ba0.5Zn2Ga2O7 were prepared by conventional high temperature solid state reactions.

#Text=Calcium carbonate (CaCO3, 99.99%), barium carbonate (BaCO3, 99.99%), strontium carbonate (SrCO3, 99.99%), lead oxide (PbO, 99.9%), zinc oxide (ZnO, 99.99%) and gallium oxide (Ga2O3, 99.99%) were used as starting materials.
#Text=All the raw materials except for PbO were heated at 500 °C for 10 h before being weighted, in order to remove any adsorbed moisture.
#Text=Stoichiometric raw materials were mixed and ground in an agate mortar and pre-heated at 800 °C for 10 h to decompose the carbonate.
#Text=After this initial calcination, the resultant powder samples were re-ground thoroughly by hands and pressed into a pellet (φ = 13 mm).
#Text=With increasing the doping content of Pb2+, the synthetic temperatures of CaBa1−xPbxZn2Ga2O7 decrease owing to the relative low melting point of PbO.
#Text=The pellets were heated in the range of 860–1100 °C for 60 h with intermediate re-grindings.
#Text=Moreover, for the preparation of CaBa1−xPbxZn2Ga2O7 (0.7 ≤ x ≤ 1), additional 10 mg PbO should be added to compensation the volatilization of PbO after every cycle of calcination.
#Text=CaSr0.5Ba0.5Zn2Ga2O7 was prepared by heating raw materials at 1100 °C for 45 h with intermediate re-grindings.
